result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher M. Denzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $116.99 paid through bond posted.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $11.70 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Court orders bond minus restitution to be applied to costs. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with M. Grahn (as named in the complaint) and/or his business-Mark's Quality Marine.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher M. Denzer

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:30 pm cases called-16CF3 & 16CF187. Defendant Kristopher M. Denzer in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter before court and questions counsel regarding sentencing today. Statement by Attorney Belville regarding information previously provided and Attorney Belville requests the court allow her to withdraw from the case based on lack of communication. Statement by DA Blader regarding request. Court makes statement to defendant regarding request of Attorney Belville-will grant Attorney Belville's request to withdraw. Defendant will need to contact SPD for appointment of subsequent counsel. Court revokes bond and remands the defendant to custody. Attorney Belville requests a recess at the request of the defendant. 
1:38 pm court recalls matters. Same appearances-Statement by Attorney Belville defendant wishes to proceed with counsel and complete sentencing today. Court questions DA Blader-DA Blader has no objection to what defendant is proposing. Court questions defendant regarding Attorney Belville-defendant wishes to proceed with sentencing today. Court determines the defendant has made a knowing, voluntary and intelligent decision for Attorney Belville to remain as counsel. Court accepts defendant's request of withdrawal of Attorney Blader. Chapter 950 addressed. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Belville. Statement by defendant. Statement by Court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS on EACH CASE: 10 month WCJ, with Huber, No Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. To begin no later than May 1, 2017. Concurrent to each other. Court does not object to jail transfer. Restitution of $116.99 in 16CF3, No contact with M. Grahn and/or his place of business-Mark's Quality Marine.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Costs to include $80 drug buy fee in 16CF187 to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court orders bond on file to be applied. DNA sample and surcharge to be assessed. Court admonishes defendant regarding expungment of DNA through DOJ. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on March 28, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

16CF-3 and 16CF-187 - Both Cases Called @ 11:48 AM: Defendant Kristopher M. Denzer in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Belville - new information has come forward today.  Counsel requests a period of time to look into new information which may effect burglary case.  Per DA:  Argues as to further delay on moving toward SEH - may be an add'l tactic to delay the matters.  State is prepared to move forward on one 16CF-187 of the matters today.  Further argument by Atty Belville.  Further argument by DA Blader.  The Court:  Will grant request to reschedule to avoid any 6th Amendment issue.  Counsel will submit video in question for Court's review prior to the next scheduled SEH date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Character letter submitted by P.Staaland on behalf of the defendant
Sentencing hearing on February 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.

11:38 am cases called. 16CF3 & 16CF187. Defendant Kristopher M. Denzer in court with attorney Amanda M. Belville.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader-agreement reached. Attorney Belville confirms. 16CF187-Preliminary hearing addressed & waived by defendant. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Belville confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 16CF3 & No Contest to Count 1 in 16CF187.   Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 16CF187. Request by Attorney Belville to adjourn matter for sentencing. Court admonishes the defendant regarding bond and potential for bail jumping.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 17, 2017 at 11:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amanda M. Belville in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S requested and scheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 09:20 am.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:19 PM: Defendant Kristopher M. Denzer in court, in custody, appears via video, appearing Pro Se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms he has refused SPD services.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he does not wish counsel, Defendant does not understand the charges filed.  Court again explained the nature of the charges and his constitutional right to counsel.   Defendant reconsiders and requests to speak with SPD.  Def referred to SPD.  ADA argues as to cash bond given the severity of what occurred.  Statement by Def as to bond request.  Cash Bond ordered as requested with conditions.  Defendant is reminded to again contact SPD - it is inferred that he will no longer be employed and will qualify for services.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
